website_summaries.verdict: If you need a powerful Wi-Fi solution for a large home, the X4S is a great choice.
pros: The Nighthawk X4S AC2600 Smart Wi-Fi Router is fast and can reach pretty much anywhere in my house
cons: The router's software interface is confusing and slow and its network storage performance can't match the competition

customer_reviews.title: 5 GHz stopped working after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: With time all things wear out but NOT after 10 months. The 5GHz does not work, like others I tried contacting Netgear and because I am over the 90 day mark they want me to pay for asking for help. When paying a large amount of money for a router, to be treated this way, to have a (now common) problem with no support -- I expected more. Amazon I trust, Netgear lost my business. Looking at new reviews for a router with better support and longevity. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR Firmware is no good
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded the firmware and started experiencing wifi connection drops, was recommended to drop back to a previous firmware, now I can't see the names of all my connected devices. NETGEAR, google these words: "Testing", "QA", "QC".
customer_reviews.author: Cocomo56

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy - Wont get your money back if its not reliable on day 1
customer_reviews.text: Purchased X4S R7800 and from moment we tried it resulted in connection issues, lags and drops while gaming when comcast's modem/router never did this. 2 service support calls within 2 days of set-up ran me through literally hours of setting changes and speed tests with staff that was difficult to understand and not empowered to do anything except these kinds of frustrating exercises. Shocked to learn I cannot return this and associated modem and mesh router intended to upgrade my system. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.author: Rick Blake

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Warranty policy.  AVOID this company.
customer_reviews.text: Had previous good experience with Netgear so I purchased the r7800. The wireless stopped working after 4 months. I have been working with routers over 20 years so I already tried most of the troubleshooting methods as well as those suggested on various forums before I contacted Netgear for warranty. UFORTUNATELY, they said since it has been past 90 days I need to pay for additional technical support before they can do any sort of warranty service. Are you kidding me? My options were $140 for an additional year of technical support but he recommended almost double for 2 years. I'm done with this company, there are many others with better policies like TP-Link, Asus, Linksys, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Router stops
customer_reviews.text: I set it up without too much of a problem using their software. Then set up my other home devices like computer, cell phone, and Alexa to connect to router and worked fine for awhile. Then the it's router name disappeared from my computer and cell phone. Could not see Netgear on my computer and cell phone's "available wi fi's. Started the whole setup from scratch and still software could not recognize the router connection. Did this several times and connected my old router and connection was easily made. I know it was not my cable connection, because twice, my old router connected easily. Never had a problem like this, with other routers.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis W. Boivin

customer_reviews.title: Very bad WiFi video streaming.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried all the recommended channels for WiFi When video streaming, it has many interruption. Called Support. They just say change channels The WiFi test never goes to best even if I am in the same room. I called tech support again. Never tried to troubleshoot. Asked me to rest to factory settings. He was only reading the script. No knowledge of network or the router. Very sad support.
customer_reviews.author: Siamak Dehghan

customer_reviews.title: Just not working right
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to upgrade from a cheaper router I had, the old one never had connection issues just lacked range and speed. So installed this one and it didn’t like connecting things at first but finally got it figured out. Over the last week however my wireless camera will go offline a few times a day and my xbox 1, which is hard wired directly into the router, losses internet even though wifi is still working. Says can’t get IP address and i have to unplug everything and boot it back up, every single day. Close to just requesting a return on the router and reinstalling the cheap one I have
customer_reviews.author: Bryan D Molitor

customer_reviews.title: Update - Damaged package; Dead on arrival - Power supply
customer_reviews.text: May 14, 2019: Replacement ordered new via Amazon. Arrived with no brown box just the retail box with a shipping label applied to the shrink wrap. The shrink wrap arrived torn and the corners of my "new" item were all damaged as in the photo. Expected to receive a new item not a damaged box. ============================== May 13, 2019: I plugged in the unit to no LED lights. Checked the led switch on the back as well as the power button and cord connection. Attempted multiple electric outlets. Power adapter (U.S., 12V 3.5A) turned out to be defective. Checked with a volt meter. Returned product and will try another new condition one again. Will update review after try #2.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Major problems with advanced features. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router directly from Amazon for about 200. I noticed that several of the advanced features didn't work at all. For example, I can only block a few websites...it doesn't work if your list of blocked sites is greater than 8-12. Also, it is supposed to have MAC filtering but I can only add a few devices....it doesn't add any more devices after a half dozen or so. This is all very odd because I have an older Netgear router that works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Powerful! Very Easy Set-Up!
customer_reviews.text: Nighthawk AC2600 Powerful! Bought this to replace our older Asus model router. We have 120 Mbps service through our ISP and with the Asus, we were only getting 10-40 Mbps. Replaced it with this router and I have ran speed checks the past 3 days, all of which range from 118-127 Mbps. It has everything I want, an attractive & sleek design with MU-MIMO, dual-band, good processor, and the ability to adjust specific router settings, perfect. All-in-all it is a great, powerful router for a respectable price. UPDATE: I have checked Internet speeds for the past week and a half (every day or every other day, twice a day) and my d/l speeds have been a consistent 110-120 Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Tolley

customer_reviews.title: It could not connect to the internet.
customer_reviews.text: My older NightHawk broke down so I bought this fancy model. After 3-4 hours carefully following the instructions (on-line, since the box only had pretty and colorful leaflet for a quick install), I spent an hour locating NetGear's customer service telephone number. The technician on the other end spoke in difficult-to-understand English. But I spent another three hours with her manipulating cords, rebooting modem, router, computer and waiting for the lights to come back on. After three hours she announced we had tried everything, and the router was defective. So I returned it, went to Costco and bought an even better NightHawk router at a better price. Installation went smoothly. Happy again.
customer_reviews.author: Apple Jack

customer_reviews.title: If you want parental controls enabled, DO NOT BUY this router. Get the R7000 instead.
customer_reviews.text: From a hardware standpoint, this router appears to be very good. However, when you try to enable Parental Controls, the new Nighthawk app points you to "Circle with Disney" for parental control setup. The catch22 is that Circle with Disney is unsupported on the R7800 router (but it is supported on the R7000). Weird I know. I just spent an hour on the phone with Netgear tech support and there is no way they are aware of to either use Circle by Disney or the old method of using OpenDNS. So, if you need some way of controlling internet access in your installation, steer clear of this router.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Eads

customer_reviews.title: Just 90 days of the warranty, If you need 1 year, you have to purchase
customer_reviews.text: I got trouble with my device. I called Amazon, Amazon not support (Ship and Sold by Amazon) for the warranty. Netgear said I have to purchase the phone support or email support or chat support to get the support for the warranty. It mean just 90 days if your hardware have problem after that you have to purchase to have warranty. Make sure you know that before you purchase. And one more thing is NETGEAR do not have Schedule Restart, you have to do it manually. Very bad experience. Will not buy any device from NETGEAR again
customer_reviews.author: Tori Swann

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap for 200.00 dollars
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy my power went out and I had to reset it up 2 times the last time it just broke. I put my passwords in and there website tells me in nit my password. I tried to put the device I had on before and it won’t support them
customer_reviews.author: Akd

customer_reviews.title: Reliability.
customer_reviews.text: Just downgraded from the X6 R8000 because of continual dropping issues that are firmware related and well-documented. Am experienced with using this router and its interface, and have found it very reliable. I much prefer the local firmware interface than web-based, or worse, smart-phone based required setups. The only minor "CON"s are It doesn't have all the features of the X6, most notably only one versus 2 higher speed 5mhz channels, and the devices attached interface, while prettier and graphic, doesn't give as much information, nor recognize the names of more advanced devices, like a Cisco Secure Router used for secure VPN. It doesn't block it, but it doesn't see the attached name.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible reach!
customer_reviews.text: I very rarely write reviews! But when a product aggravates me, I tend to! I'm sorry but this thing has terrible reach! Purchased this to improve my speeds and connections; however, the 2.4ghz is worst than my old Asus RT‐N66U's! Really?? My Nest, my Ring all off that runs on 2.4! That's why I got this thing! I even replaced my modem thinking that the lapses in coverage on my Nest Cam were due to the modem not working properly! 5ghz works OK but the 2.4ghz is a joke!
customer_reviews.author: Outbreak

customer_reviews.title: 5G quit working after 10 months.
customer_reviews.text: It was a great router, but just recently the 5G went out. 2.4G works fine but the SSID for the 5G does not show up in Wifi Analyzer. Went to the support forums. Tried everything, no change. Called to get an RMA. I was told that since it was past 90 days of phone support it would cost me $139. So, I asked for just an RMA. I was then told the Router was fine! Welp, if it was fine why would I be calling? I have tried multiple combinations of firmware and factory resets. This is super frustrating and I will not be buying another Netgear product.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Boo! Hiss!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had this even a year and it is no longer recognized on our network! It started off great, but after 6 months, just stopped working. I just updated the firmware thinking that might help, NOPE! Just a $200 door stop! So disappointed, I thought this would be turbo!! Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.author: T. Carlile

customer_reviews.title: From Day one I have had problems with this Router Tec. suppor likes to jerk me around.
customer_reviews.text: Tech support stinks they read a flow chart then they tell you that the cables that connect to 3 different Devices are the problem. when the internet stop's working but if I reboot the Router the 3 Devices start to work again! Then they tell you to call them if it happens again so they can take a look at the Router How can you trouble shoot it if there is no com. back to the internet? So now I'm stuck with a POS that I have to reboot every other day and sometimes daily To get the internet back up I will never buy another Netgear Router with there crappy tech. support.
customer_reviews.author: r cross

customer_reviews.title: Starts out great then dies.
customer_reviews.text: Spent $150 on this router thinking it would last me years. I got it April 2019 as of July 2019 it no longer provides internet access. I have restarted it, unplugged it, unplugged the modem. I reset it to factory settings and it gave me internet access then. But one week later again stopped giving me access to the internet. I tested my modem it is working when I connect directly to it. This router is not worth the money. The 5g access barely ever worked it always disconnected from it. Tech support lasts only for 3 months. Get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Did not last 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Was a great router for almost two year. A year and a half of use, it started having issues, it needed to be rebooted every week (it would stop connecting with the internet) After rebooting it would reconnect. It slowly got down to needing re-booting every other day (connecting was lost). Finally it totally failed, would not connect, tried re-booting which use to work, tried doing a factory reset, still on connection. Set up my extra (backup) router and got connected as soon as it started. These routers should last more than 1.5 to 2 years. Due to its short life, I have to get this router one star, wish I could give it ZERO stars.
customer_reviews.author: R Smith

customer_reviews.title: Replaced an older slower nighthawk that performed better.
customer_reviews.text: I'd think with all these fragile looking antennas and the price, this would be an improvement on my previous router... but it wasn't. Was hoping to use this for getting feeds from three 720p wireless cameras to a computer (10 feet away) to record locally. But didn't seem like it could really handle it, ended up having to wire them all in. This was pretty optimal conditions with a variety of settings tried in testing situations. Even got desperate and loaded DD-WRT to try and tweak things further, but didn't improve the performance noticeably. Oh well, glad to try something else, these antennas really are a pain.
customer_reviews.author: LeperSmurf

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this on recommendation from our internet provider installation tech. Such a nightmare... very difficult to set up. Worked on and off, very inconsistent- when we finally switched back to the cheap box provided by the internet company, our service was lightening fast. This was such a waste of time...it took multiple hours on the phone with foreign text support, all for nothing. The cheap $20 plug in extender gave us a better signal than this.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn J

customer_reviews.title: Stable with Great Coverage
customer_reviews.text: Why is it so hard to find a stable router that will work with a house full of devices. I have gone through so many and have a heap of unsuitable yet working routers in my closet. A router should be setup and forgotten about and this router does exactly that. I have not used many of the advanced features but it is nice that they are there. Really I am paying a premium (this router is not cheap) for stability and coverage and that is what I got at least after a few months of use. Will update if things change.
customer_reviews.author: magixman

customer_reviews.title: Run, do not walk away from Netgear
customer_reviews.text: Our unit was running fine, but we were getting connection drops every several minutes along with huge latency. Ping graphing software found ping spikes to 3500ms or so and packet loss spikes of 30 - 100% every 2 - 10 minutes. Took two weeks of troubleshooting and getting help from Netgear's unvelievably useless tech support. ("Have you tried turning it off and on again?") Despite nesrly 3 dozen identical posts in the forums, Netgear insisted it was on my end. Problem was finally solved by rolling back firmware. All of a sudden, no issues. No ping spikes, no packet loss. Nothing. Just.. bad. Avoid this like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: person

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I got this router because we have multiple devices that need access to our internet. This had good ratings, so I purchased it. Five months after getting it hooked up, it just stopped working. I ran through all the tech support options on the Netgear website, but nothing worked. I know it was the router because we took our back-up router and hooked it up and had no problems. It is frustrating when you spend that amount of money and the product only lasts for 5 months. Netgear would not warranty it as it was past the 90-days. I can't say enough about Amazon's support though they have been a great help in working with me.
customer_reviews.author: sg7769

customer_reviews.title: Buyers Beware
customer_reviews.text: This item was advertised as new. Upon purchasing this item and setting it up in my home, I had no access to change wifi settings. Once I called Netgear technical support, I discovered that the item was registered by another owner in 2017 (2 years ago) which means this item is not new. Not only was this falsely advertised, but now I cannot even get support on the device I spent almost $200 on until transferring registration to my name. Such an unnecessary hassle. I buy a lot of things on Amazon, and I have to say this is the very first time I've written a negative review (on anything).
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Laughable support and device functionality
customer_reviews.text: My google WiFi couldn’t keep up with fios gigabit morning all my smart devices. The nighthawk does it all and more getting easily for 600 mbps in multiple wireless devices at once. Just as easy to setup. YET....I bought two ex7500 extenders to connect and have nothing but bad things to say about netgear support and their products. I've rma'ed both of them and still have issues. devices not able to connect, the mesh network not handing off cleanly. calling in for support and because bounced from one rep to another who can at best read a script to walk me through the same first level diagnostics. They are expensive paper weights at best.
customer_reviews.author: ADC

customer_reviews.title: This thing locks up all the time
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this 6 months ago I thought the locking problems that I read about in the reviews would be fixed in firmware. The issues haven't been fixed, and if anything are worse after 2 firmware releases. This thing will drop WiFi, or Internet randomly and it takes a reboot to bring it back. This happens at least once a week if not more. I whole heartily recommend someone buy something thing else. This thing isn't reliable at at all.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my CenturyLink DSL Service
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about installing this myself, even though I am fairly competent at I.T. Concepts. I was pleasantly surprised to find the process quite easy, especially using the Netgear app for the iPhone. This device does require a DSL or Cable Modem (I have DSL through CenturyLink). I also updated and upgraded my DSL Modem. The combination of these devices have eliminated all dead spots in our 2,800 Sq. Ft. Home, with maximum reception everywhere. The devices are installed upstairs in my office, which is about mid-way in the length of the house. A little pricey ($300 for both), but the improvement is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve O

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: First couple weeks worked fine. Signal then deteriorated for no apparent reason, of course now beyond return date. Worthless conenction to TV on next floor but 20 feet away, sketchy connections to TVs on same floor and 20 to 40 feet away. Only good connection is to TV 3 feet away. Customer service overall is poor. They blame signal on other issues, which of course they can't address. My advice would be to not purchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Jean

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Setup with the app was easy but needed tech support to help connecting with my mesh extender and to help with changing channels for speeds. Let’s hope it continues to work My last experience with a Nethear product didn’t end well. I had an R7000 that was bricked by a firmware update and nothing but denials by Netgear. Hoping for the best with this one. Signal covers the whole house up to the 3rd floor speeds are close to direct wired on first floor and only subside by 30% on 2nd floor.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: No Time Limits in Parental Controls
customer_reviews.text: The enhanced parental control feature does not include setting time/day limits by device, which was a critical feature for me. The Netgear parental controls feature is managed through OpenDNS and is a content protection service (limits access to certain websites at the router level). While this is a great feature the lack of easy time restrictions is a deal breaker for me and I will be exchanging for an ASUS. Other than taking a few hours to figure out what was an wasn't possible with the parental controls settings, the router setup was very easy and routing performance is good.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Does not offer manual QoS control
customer_reviews.text: Product is good, but was disappointed when I couldn't manually prioritize my devices. It offers you the choice to select priorities, but it will not save them. It will appear to have saved your settings, but if you go back, the settings are reverted back. Using a different browser, resetting and reconfiguring, modem resets does nothing. I guess that's what it meant by Dynamic Quality of Service—automated. So if you want more QoS control, look for something that offers manual QoS control. This product does not have it.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Saelee

customer_reviews.title: much needed upgrade for our house!
customer_reviews.text: after researching several brands and a few days of back and forth I chose the r7800 because of its range and adaptability. the setup took a few minutes on the computer - I do not have one of those smart phones yet - and after everything in the house learned/connected what an amazing difference. We were suddenly able to stream uninterrupted shows (quite the smile on the kids face as they had become accustomed to the buffering). pages load faster on the computer - since we are working from home now that is a most welcome feature as well. all I can say is it is a welcome upgrade and addition to our web and streaming!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent router, slightly confusing admin interface
customer_reviews.text: Netgear have produced a very fast wifi router in the R7800. It allows a reasonable level of performance over wifi even with my gigbit fiber internet connection. The way they implemented the administrative interface using a blend of in-device and online services was new to me and a bit confusing at first. Once I understood what was going on, though, it was fine. To improve it, I think that there could be more explanation of each option, with more diverse examples of real-world applications. On the whole, I'm very satisfied with the value of my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Shenaut

customer_reviews.title: all as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Looked at several reviews of Netgear X4S and this seemed to be best for my needs. Relatively easy to set up by following directions on computer screen. Having set up problems with Netflix and not having much help from them. I can get Netflix on Amazon but not on app. They keep asking for password but I have submitted and Netflix acknowledged but still cannot open Netflix app. However, I will resolve. No router problems so far and no shut down like kept happening with my old router.
customer_reviews.author: Albert J Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome router
customer_reviews.text: Worked straight out of the box. Placed it behind the AT&T BGW210-700 gateway that comes with the 1 Gigabit fiber optic internet service. The setup was a breeze. You need to place the BGW210 in the passthrough mode - just google it. Using the Genie App, I installed the router within ten minutes. Just remember, you can get gigabit speeds WIRED with this router but if you want WIRELESS gigabit speeds, you will need to wait a while longer because practically all clients on the market today are using 2x2 MIMO/antennas. Expect speeds between 450Mbs-620Mbs, give or take.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE READ BEFORE BUYING
customer_reviews.text: The router worked great for a while but once you are off the warranty and you run into issues they CHARGE YOU to speak with technical support... They will not help you unless you pay for a phone warranty which is over $100 for a year and let me remind you that this is just so that you can get technical supports to help you over the phone to get your router working again. That is absolutely ridiculous. I really hope people read this before buying. When you spend $250 on a router you expect to be able to get technical support if it stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: WiFi HiFi unlimited
customer_reviews.text: Good as WiFi gets folks, was having trouble w/cable internet and they recommended I upgrade my wifi and so glad they did, server still stinks but when wifi has a signal it's everything & more. Already recommended to several, now is ur chance to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Roland M Samples

customer_reviews.title: Bad router,Horrible Tech Support from NETGEAR
customer_reviews.text: I still have a broken router, still under warranty, that Netgear fails to replace. Called tech support got this idiot on the line who insisted that I go through his script reading, not listening to a word I've said, The router keeps disconnecting from the internet, and the only way to get it back to working, is to set it back to factory settings. After that it will work for a few days then disconnects from the internet again. So I guess my next step is to call AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: Ira L. Turner

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 stars. So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out the box. Its Installed in my basement. I did not do any changes for a few days, then I made some basic changes, including the latest firmware upgrade without any problems. Compared to a CenturyLink router it replaced, I can tell that it covers a radius of 150 feet from inside the house out into the yard. I have four computers, one 4K, one HD TV, one outside camera, printer, two IPads, sometimes, all running at any given time, and no dropouts, (Router (R7800) - AC2600 connected to a 250MBps fiber link to the internet).
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Two years since purchase, giving me issues all the time
customer_reviews.text: Hi, at the beginning all wonderful, combined networks to pick the smart way to band connection, and everything else in general perfect. After two years, the router just stop working, and every time I turned the power on/off, it is a very hard time, the reboot does not work properly and always take about an hour to come back good. I do connect a new devise and it drop again.. I updated the firmware to the lasted and let it run in default configuration only settings are: Disable SLI for Mic voicechat. Change WIFI Names and PAssword, everything else the same. I won't purchase again another Netgear for a while
customer_reviews.author: Jorge A Gomez-Danes

customer_reviews.title: All good, until I wanted to block sites
customer_reviews.text: So I entered in 100 sites to be blocked by keyword. Turns out the UI only registers 25. So the 75 other sites I added couldn't be removed even when I clicked clear list. So I had to manually reset the moven and all of my other settings including multiple servers via port forwarding. Seriously it was so perfect until that one hiccup. Netgear really should fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Jay McC

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Does not work right after 3 month support expires.
customer_reviews.text: This router does not work. Every single day I have to restart my router to get wifi to work. When I wire a computer directly to the ethernet, the internet speed is as expected. After I restart the router, then the WiFi works and gets the speed that is expected. I should not have to restart my router every day to get WiFi! When I call to complain and get a replacement, they tell me the only way to get a hardware warranty replacement (supposedly a 1yr warranty), I must purchase technical support. What a joke! So basically, there is not a 1yr warranty. And conversations with their support is just rude.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Constantly Restarts
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst router I have ever owned. Do not spend your money on it. It will constantly restart itself. I have tried resetting it to factory settings, I have tried upgrading the firmware, nothing works. On top of that the router will magically reset and lose it's settings, requiring you to set it all up again. It is buy far the worst router ever created. I will be smashing mine with a hammer as soon as I get a replacement because as I was typing this it reset again. I will never buy a NetGear router or any of their equipment ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Karlovich

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Can't think of anything I don't like! Great product. we live in a large rural home with satellite service cables terminating in the garage. we have 1850 sq ft on 1st floor, 600 sq ft on second level and 1450 sq ft in the daylight basement which has 10 ft insulated concrete walls. I have never had complete wi-fi coverage until now. I can use wi-fi anywhere, even outside in my large yard! I can also manage wi-fi use remotely via i-phone for friends who use our lake home sometimes when we are gone! This unit is easy to setup via direct i-phone online connection with Netgear. Hats off to NetGear on this $150 router!
customer_reviews.author: Pops

customer_reviews.title: Reliable workhorse that serves four floors in my house without issue
customer_reviews.text: Have had the AC2600 for almost 2-1/2 years now, and it's working as great as it did when new. Provides a reliable, fast signal. Hard wired to our Fios router and used in bridge mode, it's located on the first floor of a very old house, and has no problem delivering wifi to that floor, the basement, second, third floors, and also to the Nest security cameras we have outdoors. Love that you can disable nearly all of the LED lights on the unit. Easily accessible menu to change settings if needed as well, and plenty of ports included for anything you'd like to hard-wire. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: BriGuy

customer_reviews.title: FAST wifi speed and STABLE!!
customer_reviews.text: I had used Cisco Linksys E3000 with Xfinity 100 Mbps (down steam) internet service. LAN connected internet speed was around 100 Mbps, but wifi speed was only 10 Mbps or less. After changing router to NETGEAR Nighthawk X4S, the wifi speed is 60 - 70 Mbps even though using several laptop devices simultaneously. eSATA connection is also very stable to use server. I'm pretty satisfied on this NETGEAR router. All my family can watch different movie or share data at each device from 1st floor to 3rd floor without speed disruption. FAST SPEED, SAFE SECURITY, SIMPLE SETUP, 4x LAN, 2x 3.0 USB and 1x eSATA I'm very satisfied!!
customer_reviews.author: I. Kim

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but nothing special.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying a router and came up with 2 routers that had great reviews from smallbuilders.net & Tomshardware. This one was tops in most categories and reviews (5G), the other that Tom's, recommended was the TP-Link AC2300. Found out that my parents were looking to upgrade and decided to buy this one for me and the TP-Link AC2300 for them. Now I wish I would have given them this one as not only is it more reliable, easier to set up, drops less and has better range/speed, but was cheaper....my old one was a TP-Link, should have stuck with them. Lessons learned.
customer_reviews.author: Always a Sooner4life

customer_reviews.title: The R7800 has improved my internet and network speeds over my last Nighthawk
customer_reviews.text: I love the R7800's signal strength and range at my home. It's the best I have used so far in that respect. But the firmware's UI feels awfully outdated. I am running this router in Access Point mode because I have a firewall device that serves as the DHCP server. As with most routers, some options are disabled in AP mode. I am getting Wi-Fi internet speeds that are the same as when I plug directly into the router using an Ethernet cable, so that is nice. The range is great, too. My computer-to-computer network speeds have also improved over Wi-Fi since I stopped using the Nighthawk Gaming Edition router. I'm very happy with this router.
customer_reviews.author: Juniorverse

customer_reviews.title: works well, controls are poor
customer_reviews.text: Good speeds and no complaints on the performance but the parental controls are a disaster. They're controlled through a complicated Open DNS system which is difficult to configure and control remotely. I just want a router that I can shut off a particular devise at a particular time but not all internet service, it seems simple but this router can't easily do it. Parents be warned, great for gaming but you'll have limited control over usage. Included is a screenshot of their minimal controls. You cannot control individual devices with time blocks or blocked sites, it is all or nothing on every setting. Even the MAC filtering options are weak.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Don't Purchase! Not Reliable! Return Policy Sucks for this item.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in August of 2019 and it stopped working the end of February 2020. Then came Covid-19 so could not get out. No lightning or power surge issues and backed up with surge protection. I have never had any issues with any other routers but for some reason this just is not working. Called customer support and they don't want to hear anything about it. Trying to return it for a refund / exchange but the return window is only a month, ending in September 2019. A little help would be nice. Don't know who to turn to other than post this message here. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: rosabarto

customer_reviews.title: Very solid buy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Going strong for over a year without hiccups - Powerful - Removable antennas for collapsability and clearly of quality build when connected. - Clear interface with many features, updateable firmware - Great transfer rates and wifi options - Circumvents needing a separate switch unless you have more devices that need direct wiring than it can handle. Cons: - It's gonna take up some desk real-estate. This thing is a bit of a chonker. That's it! No buyers regret, very solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Syl Cat

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF THIS PRODUCT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months my WIFI router can not connect to the internet anymore through WIFI. plugged in works fine. Netgear support says it's "Technically" working so they can't help unless i purchase gearhead support!! What a scam!! Do yourself a favor Find something else!!
customer_reviews.author: Nomas

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: This router absolutely sucks. I get kicked off wifi if I leave the room. Only one band even works. Trying to get tech support is impossible. Call the # through amazon, and the person on the line has NO IDEA what they are talking about and just feeds you crap verbatim that they are reading from the manual. Try tech support through Netgear, and you can’t understand a word they are saying b/c they are somewhere in India. I will be returning this, and going back to my cheap $40 walmart router that worked a hundred times better.
customer_reviews.author: motherof2

customer_reviews.title: Netgear Firmware Beware!!! Downgrade to .52
customer_reviews.text: The firmware is horrible. Initially I thought my internet connection was the issue. The ISP tech guy came twice but the wifi kept dropping. After reading through Netgear forum, downgraded the firmware to .60. Still wifi kept on dropping. Used Voxel firmware. It improved a bit but still dropped now and then. Finally downgraded to their stock .52. It's stable now. Let's see how long that goes.
customer_reviews.author: Optimus

customer_reviews.title: Signal is reliable and fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: It's a fantastic product. The html interface could use a lot of work. It took numerous hours of work to make the web filter work... And it never did. Eventually I just turned to opendns (which is the same provider they use for their web filter) and took the approach that any router and any user could take to filter their web access.
customer_reviews.author: B. Setliff

customer_reviews.title: One year later - mostly crippled.
customer_reviews.text: Just a few days shy of 1 year old and my router slowed to a stop. Speed Test shows 1ms ping time, and rates up to 240mps -- AFTER the DNS resolves. Oh, the dreaded "Resolving DNS..." problem. Online FAQs to troubleshoot, nope. Customer support via their Twitter handle - nope. Discussion boards with potential solution, nope. So, I enabled VPN to (somehow magically) get past the router bug, and my tops speed: 5mps. Not a tough trade-off, shopping for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tot1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router with possibly pathetic support
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the router because I thought that was the problem in my house. New router is installed as access point and the wifi signal now fills every corner of the house. It is annoying that you an not use certain functionality (parental control!) when this router is being used in AP mode. Overall, i am happy with the hardware. Netgear support is another thing. 3 months! is all you get for tech support in case you run into any problem. After that, you pay to talk to someone from india or China. Your best mode of help is community forum, as if you are dealing with opensource software.
customer_reviews.author: suman

customer_reviews.title: Netgear for the win!
customer_reviews.text: I previously used the Nighthawk AC1900 for the last 5 years until I believed it was beginning to glitch (it ended up being our internet provider having consistent issues in our area) . So I decided to upgrade to more power and more area coverage, because why not?! It actually covers my entire block, with great speed . Setup was beyond easy that a caveman could do it and the ability to change settings was easy as well. I’ll continue to use Netgear products for many years to come, they’ve never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Amlindstrom

customer_reviews.title: Ok Router but security is bad.
customer_reviews.text: There IS A PROBLEM with this model of router and NETGEAR WON'T FIX IT. If you use wireless DO NOT log into the user interface, Use a hard-line (Ethernet Cable) to connect directly to the router! Netgear does not use/offer Https to log-in or use the user interface, So anyone packet sniffing random traffic can capture what your doing and have you log-in and passwords both wifi and admin passwords.
customer_reviews.author: D H

customer_reviews.title: Staggeringly poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue with the LAN port. Or working on the R7800 and tech support closed the request. Tried another device and simultaneously opened a registration request and that was closed. But Netgear did send a survey which is the only thing that worked. Guess hi got low marks! For a modern technology company they are simply outdated in their handling. Try the archer products which work out of the box, not suggesting archer is trouble free, so that you don’t waste your time as an average consumer for a router.
customer_reviews.author: Sigara

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great piece of equipment that meets my needs! Mostly!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good wifi router. Excellent speed & capacity for all of my internet needs. I recently purchased a 4K television and am able to stream any and all UHD video to it without any buffering delays. Couldn't do that with my older router wifi. Extremely impressive! I am a bit disappointed in the range of the wifi. Maybe I expected too much? My house is not massive but the wifi router does not reach some of the far corners. In fact the Xfinity wifi router that I am replacing actually has a stronger signal in those corners as compared to the Netgear. Overall a great piece of equipment that meets my needs!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Router
customer_reviews.text: As a former technician, I have experience with more routers than I care to admit. There are routers with good hardware and lousy firmware and vice versa, and no price point changes that. That being said, I needed a new router at home and decided to buy this one instead of a mesh network in a box. Configured everything just the way the old one was and haven't looked back. This router eliminated a router and an access point with better range.
customer_reviews.author: A L

customer_reviews.title: The router is the best
customer_reviews.text: This router is handling my entire smart home infrastructure, about ten video devices, and just as many PCs/tablets/phones. So far have not had a single problem dealing with all these devices. Watching 4k on multiple devices, no problem. Kids going crazy around the house, coloring, turning on and off lights for fun, no problem. High definition security system cloud backup, no problem. If you need a router to handle a lot of devices over a large (or small) area with high bandwidth, then the Nighthawk routers are the router to beat.
customer_reviews.author: K. P.

customer_reviews.title: Great router overall
customer_reviews.text: I got this router to replace an old router that was like 8 years old. The old one had limited signal and old technologies and would lose connection a lot. But with this new router, it is night and day. I always have full connection in my house and with great speeds. I did some research before I went and bought this router and for the price, this is the best out there. Fastest processor, best connection potential and technologies behind it. Overall me and my family are very pleased with our new router.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted....
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned this for 17 months and in the past month all I keep doing is losing my internet connection. I’ve called my internet company on numerous occasions and we’ve done all we can on our end but it’s getting pretty annoying to constantly lose the connection to everything we own. Something that cost me $200 should last longer than 17 months. I bought based on reviews and either I’ve received a bad product or quality is just not what it should be. And of course this happened after the 1 year warranty was up. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryle

customer_reviews.title: Great product, didn't work out in my application.
customer_reviews.text: So when the signal was being output, we had a 25% increase of upload and download compared to our old router. It was on the money of what they said we should have, this nighthawk boosted that even. I had 8 hours of phone time with tech support and we weren't able to keep it from having an intermittent signal. I'm pretty bummed, but I do t think this is the routers fault. I blame the combination of my modem and that router being incompatible.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Belles

customer_reviews.title: I used to like this router  -  R7800
customer_reviews.text: It no longer sends out a 5 GHz frequency after a recent update. I have used Netgear for years. From what I have read, this is an ongoing problem that should have been fixed months ago. I'm not about to order another Netgear because the same thing might happen. I just upgraded to a 50 Mbps service but can't get more than 35 Mbps. I would like to get what I am paying for.
customer_reviews.author: A. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, But Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Setup and install took less than 5 minutes. Router floods my three-story townhouse with upwards of 40x more strength than the DSL wireless router CenturyLink provided me (C1000A was getting 1MB/s in the living room; now I get 40MB/s). The activity lights are actually quite bright, but there is an option to manage that. I don't use many of the router's features, but it does exactly what I'd hoped it did. Finally, the Android app is fantastic, especially being able to set up guest connections for when company visits and monitor exactly which connections are currently hitting my router.
customer_reviews.author: Jared K. Wengert

customer_reviews.title: Fast, powerful alternative to ISP gateways
customer_reviews.text: I bought both this and a range extender to deal with some dead spots in my two-story home. It only took a few minutes to realize the range extender wasn't cutting it. I have AT&T Fiber with an Arris BGW 210-700 gateway with horrible wireless performance. This corrects all those deficincies, providing a faster, smoother wireless experience. My only complaint is that an actual printed quick start guide would be preferable to the online guide. I feel like this would've alleviated some of my confusion during the setup. But all-in-all, I was able to get it up and running with minimal effort, and I'm quite pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: QoS isn't as great as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I got this router primarily because of latency issues I have on my home network. I haven't tried to contact support, but not sure it's worth it. I was hoping this would provide a more stable connection for a few devices, however it doesn't do that all the time. After a reboot, all the manual settings I put into the QoS are reset, and I'm not able to see bandwidth usage by device. I'm a little disappointed, this doesn't do much more that the router provided by my ISP.
customer_reviews.author: lou lou

customer_reviews.title: One Year Old and Drops Connections
customer_reviews.text: Bought the R7800 in January 2019. Last couple of months it just refuses to connect to internet even though it shows connected every website is unreachable. After doing multiple hard resets it will eventually connect so far. May come a time when it won't connect at all. When it works it works well but lately I have noticed an occasional buffering when streaming video. One year from a $200 router is ridiculous. Router has the latest firmware also.
customer_reviews.author: Maxima18

customer_reviews.title: Netgear R7800 wifi Router
customer_reviews.text: So far it has better signal strength than the r7000 I've used. With mu-mimo it handles multiple devices streaming better as well. Netgear software will work but to me it could be WAY better if revamped. Some strange things are: R7800 has a manual led light switch on back but you can turn off via software? Netgear still using unencrypted http web interface options, still using "admin" as usernames which cant be changed unless you do a opensource firmware etc, and genie or UP apps are blandly outdated in true functionality. For now I'm using as an AP only. Oem firmware has media server and share support as well as openvpn.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this router!
customer_reviews.text: No more throttling from your network provider! This thing is super fast, however you’d think pairing it with another Netgear product (modem) would be simple....not so. Even the guy on their support line said it’s a difficult thing to do. If you’re pairing this with their modem you’ll be on hold with their customer/technical support for a LOOOOOONG time. But when I did get connected they solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great and worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: If you want plenty of coverage and a decent wifi this is it. You get what you pay for with the cheaper ones. This is worth every penny, easy to set up and I love the app which allows you to control whose got access. This is definitely pushing out faster speeds compared to the crappy one spectrum gave us
customer_reviews.author: Richard Holland

customer_reviews.title: Netgear Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I researched many makes and models of wireless routers before selecting the Netgear Nighthawk x45. Set up was a breeze. The user interface is logical and I was up and running in no time. Major improvement in signal strength . I still cannot believe how much faster my wireless network is! This wireless router is truly designed to handle multiple devices at the same time. I was able to download an entire digital audio album with 16 songs in 24 seconds! I highly recommend this router to anyone in the market for their first or replacement wireless router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I want to return this! I tried to set it up and finally had to call netgear for help. The person I talked to me and tried to help for over 3 hours and nothing works correctly. I don't want this.
customer_reviews.author: krys

customer_reviews.title: Could use some work, firmware is still buggy
customer_reviews.text: Had to perform a factory reset after about 3 weeks of having this item. The router kept restarting itself several times a day, dropping the signal for all wireless and wired devices. The modem it is passing through did not drop service so I knew this was router specific. After performing a factory reset and setting up again it has been working without issue. Signal is great when it is working over out 1740 sqft home, and even when I'm outside it I have no issue loading things on my phone or laptop.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for today’s smart homes.
customer_reviews.text: This router is exactly what you need in today’s gone filled with smart products, from TVs to thermostats to virtual assistants that help us with every aspect of our lives. I tried using two different brands of routers, and was not satisfied until using the NetGear. It really has secured my whole household while giving me faster speeds than I currently pay for. It was simple as could be to set up as well.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: Working from home for weeks and struggling daily with bad internet connection until i made the decision to buy this amazing router and i realized what a huge difference this piece of technology art can make. Excellent wifi signal in every corner of my 2800 sqft house. It handles perfectly 40 smary devices connected. Sped is now 5x faster and no more glitches and lagging. Strong buy and it definitely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is quick. If you’re picking between the 7000 and 7800, the 7800 is much faster. I have gigabit Ethernet and I am getting much quicker Speeds both hard wired and over WiFi. So far so good. Update: 6/8/18: This router is still awesome, however, I am having to reboot it pretty frequently (1-2 times a week at most), which is kinda lame. It's not that difficult to do, especially with the app, but it's still a nuisance. Moving down to 4 stars. Update 6/22/18: I purchased a usb cpu fan to put under this bad boy and I have not had to restart it once over the past 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Netgear router
customer_reviews.text: This nearly $200 router failed 5 months in !! Netgear gave me a hassle when I requested a replacement, even though I am a Network Engineer, and had did everything possible to make it work. I had to call them 3 times and jump through all their hoops before they finally agreed it was defective. Prior to this failure, I had purchased a less expensive Netgear as a backup. It was basically DOA out of the box. My previous Netgear (also a $120+ unit) failed a few months out of warranty. While I have no idea which brand of router I will settle on next, I can however assure you it won't be a Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: matt elliott

customer_reviews.title: Crap Router
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the Nighthawk X4S AC2600 Smart WiFi Router (R7800). All in all its a great router: works well, easy to set up and looks cool. Only things that are annoying are 1. the antenna are really easy to knock over and 2. Dynamic QOS isn't the default, you have to turn it on. Update: This router is trash. It randomly restarts all the time, especially when theres a heavy bandwidth draw. Ended up throwing it out when I found out this is a common problem and there is no way to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Bernick

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: This is the best router I have owned. Great coverage, Great bandwidth monitoring, great speed, great app and ease of setup. I had the router up in running in minutes. Does a great job using the features for giving priority to streaming and gaming needs. One item of concern is it shipped behind on firmware updates as expected, but needed to use website to update firmware could not do it from the app.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Louks

customer_reviews.title: Latest firmware update is buggy garbage
customer_reviews.text: I set this up and let it update out of the box. Never again will I put the current firmware (1.0.2.68) on without a thorough vetting. Devices connected to the 5GHz wireless had all kinds of problems, mostly talking to DNS. I rolled back to 1.0.2.52, and all of those problems went away. I'm still contemplating loading up DD-WRT or OpenWRT to give myself more control, but that's a project for another day. Pros: FAST. I can saturate my 100M service with any device in my house at any time, anywhere the building. Cons: Current firmware is utter garbage.
customer_reviews.author: A D G

customer_reviews.title: As Expected!! Another winner for NETGEAR!!
customer_reviews.text: Netgear has delivered again. There was no doubt in my mind on which brand I was going for. Netgear simply delivers. I live in Doha, and my apartment has thick concrete walls. I was worried that the signal might not penetrate through the walls, but it does exceptionally well on 2.4ghz and on 5ghz. My speeds dramatically improved sinced I installed this router. The ease of setup, and the interface are fast and slick. I refuse to buy another brand of routers!
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Achieve

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted two years
customer_reviews.text: The router worked fine for the first year and a half but started having issues like losing the Internet connection or dropping the attached USB drives. It finally gave up the ghost almost two years to the day after I bought it. Given the purchase price (over $200) of this model, I expected to last a long longer than my older router, which was half the price. That one still works!
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: Randomly disconnects and have to go reset it
customer_reviews.text: I got this to upgrade my Netgear C3700. Getting access to the C3700's GUI was a huge headache at first, but eventually it worked great and seldom disconnected (if ever). I only got the R7800 to have the option for VPN connections. Unlike the C3700, the R7800 likes to disconnect at least once a day. Sometimes I can login and click the "Test" button to fix it, but other times it doesn't let me login or kicks me off WiFi, at which point I have to go reset it physically. It's probably fixable through a firmware downgrade or something (I have the newest firmware version), but that shouldn't be necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for Mom
customer_reviews.text: Since social distancing, my kids are up all night on their electronics. Nighthawk smart router allows me to shut off WiFi to different devices in the house. No more yelling and fighting with my kids! I shut the wifi off with the Nighthawk app on my phone!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Catanzariti

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't depend on it
customer_reviews.text: When it worked it was great. Unfortunately after about 2 weeks it started dropping the internet connection. initially only for a few seconds. Then it started getting worse and had to be rebooted which was a real chore because you had to log into the web control panel and reset the DNS lease to get it reconnect. It had great potential. I just couldn't depend on it.
customer_reviews.author: Lawman

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Its worth than $99 Asus router I had. My house is 2nd story building, and I can't even upgrade 21mb file to PS3 in downstair. I had no problems with the Asus router, but this one is junk. No matter what I try wireless speed is so slow that I am changing the router back to Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Jin Kim

customer_reviews.title: May not be the fastest on the market... but it's stable as a rock
customer_reviews.text: Going into this, I knew it wasn't going to be the fastest router available on the market, but after reading tons of reviews (especially the one on smallnet builder) and having a great experience with my R7000, I gave this a shot. I can say I am thoroughly impressed. No issues, great range, multiple devices connected on both bands, and the stability is amazing. If you're looking for a router that just works, this is the one to get. Setup was fairly painless as well. Currently have it running as an AP for Verizon FIOS service.
customer_reviews.author: Xero

customer_reviews.title: Wifi Issues!!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this router on sale. Set it up, and seemed to work fine. Every so often, the wifi signal will just drop. It'll take a few minutes to reconnect. The modem is not the problem. The modem has worked flawlessly with other routers. This router is the problem. After doing some research, it seems like netgear released a buggy firmware version. They haven't released a fix yet. I shouldn't have so many issues with a new router.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Router! I needed a new router to replace ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Router! I needed a new router to replace my OLD Netgear R900. I did A LOT of research and reading prior to purchasing this router. In the end, I decided to go with the X4S. Very glad I did. Setup is very quick and easy. Works great. This router extended my wifi range considerably compared to my old R900. On an average day I have probably 15+ devices connected to this router through WiFi and 2 hardwired via Ethernet cable. This router handles all my traffic with no lag / problems and I have noticed an increase in speed. With my old R900, my NAS Server would buffer when streaming movies to the TV's. 0 issues with this X4S.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Q

customer_reviews.title: Stay away - buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.text: This router worked okay for about a year. It was reliable for the most part with a few random resets. That is until now... The router now drops internet (both wifi and cat5) every few minutes. It reboots and recycles itself so all data upload/download is lost. Because it's become so frequent the router is no loner usable. Netgear support won't help unless I buy one of their ridiculously priced support packages which cost the same as a new router. Yes, I've factory reset it. Firmware is upgraded. I even opted for the highly optimized Vexel firmware. None of that has helped. This is trash tech - stay away - buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.author: Growler Cutlery

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service and poor firmware
customer_reviews.text: Terrible customer service. I highly recommend switch to the firmware that lol the other reviews talk about. Once I updated to the most recent firmware my router now reboots itself random throughout the day. Calling their customer service, to me, is almost like a scam. If you don’t call for a problem within 90 days of purchase, you have to pay for them to help you over the phone. They have so much pride on their most recent firmware and only recommend updated to the most latest. When clearly based on everyone’s experience including mine that each update just ruins it more and more. I thought this was a great brad based on its high reviews, but don’t be fooled.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I recently changed over my router over to the Nighthawk. I originally was using the one supplied by my cable company. I can only say good things about the Nighthawk. It was super easy for me to set up with the App. It has substantially increased my Internet speed when streaming TV and movies. I now get Internet in parts of my house that were a dead zone before. Over all great product and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: aubrey

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit expensive; but it was easy to install and seems very reliable (so far). Signal strength seems good, even in the back yard. Nice feature is the ability to turn off the LED indicators, without affecting operation. The LEDs can light up a dark room. It has a ton of features that I have yet to try out. What I wanted was ease of installation, good/steady signal strength and reliability ... so far so good. I would buy this unit again.
customer_reviews.author: buyer NOYB

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Nighthawk X4S Smart WiFi Router (R7800) - AC2600 Wireless Speed (up to 2600 Mbps) | Up to 2500 sq ft Coverage & 45 Devices | 4 x 1G Ethernet, 2 x 3.0 USB, and 1 x eSATA ports
product_meta.description: Model:AC2600 WiFiNighthawk X4S AC2600 Smart WiFi Router with 160MHz, MU-MIMO, and Quad Stream technology delivers WiFi to multiple devices simultaneously for faster speeds. Stream 4K content in pristine quality with 160MHz support while receiving ultimate WiFi speeds of up to 2.53Gbps, with a powerful 1.7GHz dual-core processor. Enjoy smoother streaming and gaming by prioritizing application and device with Dynamic QoS. WiFi Range - Very large homes.
feature_bullets: Fast wifi performance: Get up to 2500 square feet wireless coverage with AC2600 speed (Dual band up to 800 + 1733 Mbps). WiFi Band-Simultaneous Dual Band WiFi - Tx/Rx 4x4 (2.4GHz)+ 4x4 (5GHz)
Recommended for up to 45 devices: Reliably stream videos, play games, surf the internet, and connect smart home devices.
Wired ethernet ports: plug in computers, game consoles, streaming players, and other nearby wired devices with 4 x 1 gigabit ethernet ports.
Loaded with advanced technology: Designed with a 1.7GHz dual core processor, 4 amplified antennas, Beamforming, MU-MIMO, Dynamic QoS, Amazon Alexa Voice Controls, and more.
Usb connections: Share a storage drive and printer with any connected device, and create a personal cloud storage to access from anywhere, using the 2 x 3.0 USB and 1 x eSATA ports.
Smart parental controls: The Nighthawk app lets you manage device internet access and filter websites.
